name: Test the connection.
justification: As per the project specifications, the Client has to connect to the Server.

name: Invalid localhost port number in the URL.
justification: If the user accidentally enters an invalid port number (in this case including a letter), the client should be able to handle it and not break. It's mentioned in requirement 2: 'If, however, any other reply status code is received (i.e. codes starting with 4 or 5), print a descriptive error message to System.err, and terminate with process exit code the same as the reply status code.'

name: Catch 'absolute nonesene' in the server response: non-numeric status.
justification: As mentioned in the project specification Requirement 2 in 'Course Project: Gemini Lite', 'the client must print an error report to System.err, must not output anything to System.out, and must terminate with exit code 1.'

name: Listen on optional custom port (not hardcoded 1958)
justification: As per Requirement 3, the server must accept an optional [<port>] argument. This test checks that the server can listen on a custom port (2000 in this case) instead of the default 1958.
